Description: An internal parity error was detected in the TCE logic.
IODA Error: An access type conflicted with the allowed permis- sions in the TCE translation during the TCE request phase (on TCE cache lookup).
IODA Error: An access type conflicted with the allowed permis- sions in the TCE translation during the TCE response phase.
An overflow condition occurred in one of the TCE queues.
An underflow condition occurred in one of the TCE queues.

This is the 'fail-safe' secure address range check for TCE requests that can be issued to the AIB bus. The logic will not allow a TCE request to be issued that matches a secure address space. This fail-safe covers the multi-level TCE table cases and all cases where HV firmware might have pre-loaded the caches, and so forth.
An illegal state was reached in the TCE Cache.
A TCE Address look up in the TCE cache hit against multiple way entries.
A TCE request did not receive its TCE response before the time- out period.
A correctable ECC error was detected in the TCR array.
An uncorrectable ECC error was detected in the TCR array.
A correctable ECC error was detected in the TDR array.
An uncorrectable ECC error was detected in the TDR array.
A TCE response was received with a TCE tag that did not match any outstanding TCE requests.
An internal parity error was detected in the RRB logic.
A request to the Remote Register Block (RRB) for this macro had bad size or address alignment.
An internal parity error was detected in the TCE logic.
TCE local error, internal register bad address error.
TCE local error, internal register read / write access to a register had incorrect size or address alignment.
An overflow condition occurred in one of the TCE queues.
An underflow condition occurred in one of the TCE queues.
The TCE data from the TXE macro interface had a parity error.

Field Mnemonic: TCE Kill State Machine One-Hot Error
Description: The internal TCE kill state machine signaled a one-hot state error.

Assert an error if a new TCE request from the DEC/TVT block if the fetch address matches secure range.
Error check of RPN of TCE response for DMAs. This is a check of the secure range of the RPN bits.
